message: Creating this thread so that as we develop different parts we can post updates to keep each other running and debugging locally.
2. create a file, meetup_api_key.py in the same folder as settings.py, that sets MEETUP_API_KEY to your personal Meetup.com developer key.
The home page is actually use the meetup.com API now, which means you need the wrapper dependency and an API key.
@estebistec thanks! Got it up and running.
I notice that the meetup.com API calls are actually a little slow, so that caching should help us alot in production
Setting up email today. Running locally will now require either:
just configure the console backend locally (django.core.mail.backends.console.EmailBackend)
smtp_account.py including email settings for the SMTP backend; or...
all of the settings in meetup_api_key.py and smtp_account.py are now expected to be found in: private_settings.py
So this is insufficient, and the info may as well live with the code: https://github.com/pythonkc/pythonkc.com/blob/master/docs/local_development.rst
